titleStmt.title: Proverbs: collection 10 -- an English prose translation

publicationStmt.distributor: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature

address.addrLine: The Oriental Institute, University of Oxford, Pusey Lane, Oxford OX1 2LE, UK, email etcsl@orinst.ox.ac.uk, http://etcsl.orinst.ox.ac.uk

seriesStmt.p: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature aims to make accessible over 400 literary works composed in the Sumerian language in ancient Mesopotamia during the late third and early second millennia BC. The works are in Sumerian composite transliteration and English prose translation with bibliographical information on each composition.

sourceDesc.p: Sources are listed in the header of the composite text

lg.p: cf. 6.1.09.a1, 6.2.5: IM43438 Seg. A l. 1 Whatever the man in authority said, it was not pleasant.
cf. 6.1.09.a2 Whatever the man in authority said, it was not right.
cf. 6.1.09.a3, 6.2.2: MDP 27 216, 6.2.5: IM 43438 Seg. A l. 2 When the authorities are wise, and the poor are loyal, it is the effect of the blessing of Aratta.
cf. 6.1.09.a4, 6.1.22: l. 190, 6.2.3: UET 6/3 80 l. 18 The mighty man is master of the earth.
cf. 6.1.09.a5 It is from a man's mouth that strength comes.
cf. 6.1.09.a6, 6.2.3: UET 6/3 462 Strength cannot keep pace with intelligence.
cf. 6.1.09.a7 The strength of my god completes my own.
cf. 6.1.09.a8, 6.1.17.b3, ll. 12-13, 5.6.7: l. 28 Youthful vigour has left my loins, like a runaway donkey.
cf. 6.1.17.b3, l. 14, 6.1.19.a1, l. 1, 5.6.7: l. 29 My black mountain has sprouted white gypsum.
cf. 6.1.17.b3, l. 15, 6.1.19.a1, ll. 2-3, 5.6.7: l. 30 My mother sent to me a man from the forest, who has given me paralysed hands.

cf. 6.1.17.b3, ll. 16-17, 6.1.19.a1, ll. 4-5, 5.6.7: l. 31 My mongoose, which used to eat strong-smelling food
1 ms. has instead: meat , can no longer stretch its neck toward a jar of ghee.
The lap three (?) times, the eye (?) seven times is what she says to the one about to breach her defences.

p.q: Let me fill your new storehouse with my old hay.

lg.p: A man turned toward you. What did he seize?
Her girl friend answered her as follows.
